section: (c) "CUSTOMERS" means all users who access Co-Branded Site and complete at least one transaction per month.
explanation: The definition of "CUSTOMERS" as users who complete at least one transaction *per month* is overly restrictive and misaligned with the payment terms outlined later in Section 5.1, which base advertising fees on Transaction Inquiries. A user could generate multiple Transaction Inquiries in a month but only complete one transaction, still qualifying as a "Customer" under this definition but potentially devaluing the advertising fee calculation for 2TheMart. This means that the term Customer should only mean that they complete 1 transaction, not 1 transaction per month.

section: 8.1 TERM. The term of this Agreement shall continue for one (1) year following the Launch Date, unless earlier terminated as provided herein. This Agreement may be renewed for any number of successive one (1) year terms by mutual written agreement of the parties prior to the conclusion of the term of this Agreement. A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect. A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect. In the event that neither party expresses a desire to renew the agreement in writing, the term of this Agreement shall expire automatically.
explanation: There is duplicate language indicating that 'A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect.'

section: 12.6 NOTICE. Any notices hereunder shall be given to the appropriate party at the address specified below or at such other address as the party shall specify in writing. Notice shall be deemed given: only upon personal delivery; if sent by fax, only if acknowledged by phone; or if sent by a reputable overnight courier with tracking capabilities, only three (3) days after the date of mailing: To i-Escrow: i-Escrow, Inc. 1730 South Amphlett Blvd., #215 San Mateo, CA 94402 Fax no. (650) 638-7890 Attention: President
explanation: 1.  Notice Requirements Contradiction: This section defines how notices are to be given and when they are deemed received. However, the requirements are contradictory: the text states that notice is only deemed given "only three (3) days after the date of mailing" if sent by overnight courier. This contradicts the earlier part of the sentence, creating ambiguity regarding the valid methods and timing for delivering legally binding notices.
